unnormalised: So, you wanna get into DU, huh? Buckle up, bhai! It's less of an admission process and more of a Hunger Games with cut-offs. Jokes aside, seriously tho, getting into your dream course at a top DU college is like winning the lottery, but instead of money, you get existential dread and 4 years of struggling to find a seat in the library.
normalised: So, you want to get into D-U, huh? Buckle up, bhai! It is less of an admission process and more of a Hunger Games with cut-offs. Jokes aside, seriously though, getting into your dream course at a top D-U college is like winning the lottery, but instead of money, you get existential dread and four years of struggling to find a seat in the library.

unnormalised: First things first, 12th standard marks. You better have scored above 95%, or else, just pre-pone your plans for DU. I'm kidding... mostly. But seriously, prepare for sky-high cutoffs. Remember that one mark you lost 'cause you wrote "colour" instead of "color"? Yeah, that's gonna haunt you. The application process starts around May/June, so keep checking the DU website. Don't be that guy who misses the deadline and then blames everyone but himself.
normalised: First things first, twelfth standard marks. You better have scored above ninety five percent, or else, just pre-pone your plans for D-U. I am kidding... mostly. But seriously, prepare for sky-high cutoffs. Remember that one mark you lost because you wrote "colour" instead of "color"? Yeah, that is going to haunt you. The application process starts around May or June, so keep checking the D-U website. Do not be that guy who misses the deadline and then blames everyone but himself.

unnormalised: Next up, the CUET exam. This thing is like the new kid on the block trying to replace the good ol' percentage system. Study well, practice those mock tests, and don't forget to pray to every god you know. Seriously, all the best! But hey, even if you don't get your dream college in the 1st list, don't lose hope. There are multiple rounds and maybe, just maybe, Lady Luck will smile upon you in the 3rd or 4th cutoff list.
normalised: Next up, the C-U-E-T exam. This thing is like the new kid on the block trying to replace the good old percentage system. Study well, practice those mock tests, and do not forget to pray to every god you know. Seriously, all the best! But hey, even if you do not get your dream college in the first list, do not lose hope. There are multiple rounds and maybe, just maybe, Lady Luck will smile upon you in the third or fourth cutoff list.

unnormalised: And lastly, remember to enjoy the process! Well, as much as one can enjoy the anxiety-inducing rollercoaster that is DU admissions. Explore different courses, visit the colleges (if you can), and most importantly, have faith in yourself. And hey, if all else fails, there's always IGNOU. Just kidding! (mostly). Good luck, future DU-ite! ðŸ˜‰
normalised: And lastly, remember to enjoy the process! Well, as much as one can enjoy the anxiety-inducing rollercoaster that is D-U admissions. Explore different courses, visit the colleges (if you can), and most importantly, have faith in yourself. And hey, if all else fails, there is always I-G-N-O-U. Just kidding! (mostly). Good luck, future D-U-ite! wink
